intro: Phyllanthus symphoricarpoides, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a small shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruit capsules that split open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, warm climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
